intro: Mesembryanthemum explanatum, commonly known as the flatleaf ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically blooming in spring and summer. It is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun with well-draining soil. Mesembryanthemum explanatum is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
